pullRequest.title: Throws error when annotated services have suspend fun without `armeria-kotlin`
pullRequest.bodyText:
fixes: #3018
Motivation:
Without the armeria-kotlin dependency, Armeria cannot invoke Kotlin suspending methods defined in annotated services,
and the error messages are difficult to understand.
This is one of current error messages.
(Compiled suspending functions have kotlin.coroutines.Continuation as a parameter)
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: failed to parse a JSON document: com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.exc.InvalidDefinitionException: Cannot construct instance of `kotlin.coroutines.Continuation` (no Creators, like default constructor, exist): abstract types either need to be mapped to concrete types, have custom deserializer, or contain additional type information
 at [Source: (String)"{}"; line: 1, column: 1]
...

Modifications:
AnnotatedServiceFactory.create checks if a given method is suspending.
If the method is suspending and armeria-kotlin is missing, Armeria throws an exception with the message
Kotlin suspending functions cannot be used. You should add the armeria-kotlin dependency

and don't start an application.

  full error message
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Kotlin suspending functions cannot be used. You should add the armeria-kotlin dependency.
	at com.linecorp.armeria.internal.server.annotation.AnnotatedServiceFactory.create(AnnotatedServiceFactory.java:246)
	at com.linecorp.armeria.internal.server.annotation.AnnotatedServiceFactory.lambda$find$0(AnnotatedServiceFactory.java:184)
	at java.base/java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$7$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:271)
	at java.base/java.util.Collections$2.tryAdvance(Collections.java:4747)
	at java.base/java.util.Collections$2.forEachRemaining(Collections.java:4755)
	at java.base/java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:484)
	at java.base/java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:474)
	at java.base/java.util.stream.ReduceOps$ReduceOp.evaluateSequential(ReduceOps.java:913)
	at java.base/java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234)
	at java.base/java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.collect(ReferencePipeline.java:578)
	at com.linecorp.armeria.internal.server.annotation.AnnotatedServiceFactory.find(AnnotatedServiceFactory.java:187)
	at com.linecorp.armeria.server.AnnotatedServiceBindingBuilder.buildServiceConfigBuilder(AnnotatedServiceBindingBuilder.java:262)
	at com.linecorp.armeria.server.VirtualHostBuilder.lambda$build$8(VirtualHostBuilder.java:890)
	at java.base/java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$7$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:271)
	at java.base/java.util.Spliterators$ArraySpliterator.forEachRemaining(Spliterators.java:948)
	at java.base/java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:484)
	at java.base/java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:474)
	at java.base/java.util.stream.ReduceOps$ReduceOp.evaluateSequential(ReduceOps.java:913)
	at java.base/java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234)
	at java.base/java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.collect(ReferencePipeline.java:578)
	at com.linecorp.armeria.server.VirtualHostBuilder.build(VirtualHostBuilder.java:901)
	at com.linecorp.armeria.server.ServerBuilder.build(ServerBuilder.java:1452)
	at example.armeria.server.annotated.kotlin.MainKt.newServer(Main.kt:39)
	at example.armeria.server.annotated.kotlin.MainKt.main(Main.kt:12)


Result:
Users who want use Kotlin coroutines with annotated services can notice that the armeria-kotlin dependency is needed.

nodes.bodyText: How about just checking whether CALL_KOTLIN_SUSPENDING_METHOD is null instead of introducing another field?

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * Returns true if the last parameter of a method is a kotlin.coroutines.Continuation.

How about renaming :error-message to :annotated-service? I think the error-message name is too specific for a module name and hard to predict what is tested in the module.

Did we document about Kotlin suspending functions before? If so, how about adding a URL to the exception message? e.g.
Kotlin suspending functions are supported only when you added 'armeria-kotlin' as a dependency.
See https://armeria.dev/.... for more information.
